Letter to the Editor

Letter to the Editor  Why I grabbed the flag

City

ProPalestine proIsrael protestors clash at Tulane

Scott Houtkin Contributing WriterSeptember  

The Green Wave womens tennis team opened its fall season after competing in the Samford Invitational in Birmingham Alabama PERIOD The team finished with a winning record following all three days of competition and went  overall for the weekend PERIOD

Tulane enters this season coming off a quarterfinal exit to the Memphis Tigers at last seasons American Athletic Conference Championship PERIOD The Green Wave finished last year with a  record including a  record at home PERIOD However the Wave finished just  in conference play making them a fifth seed entering the conference championships PERIOD

The Green Wave got off to a fast start at the Samford Invitational tournament PERIOD Tulane went  in their singles matches and undefeated in all four doubles matches finishing day one with an overall record of  PERIOD

The Wave kept it rolling into day two going  in singles matches PERIOD However Tulane struggled in doubles going winless and finished the day with an overall record of  PERIOD

After two consecutive days of impressive tennis Tulane finished the weekend strong going  in singles matches PERIOD After a disappointing  showing in doubles on day two the Wave responded in a big way by going undefeated in all three doubles matches PERIOD Tulane dominated day three with a record of  and finished the weekend  PERIOD

Tulanes success this weekend was truly a collective effort PERIOD Senior Lahari Yelamanchili led the way for the Wave going  in her singles matches and  in doubles with her partner junior Charlotte Russell PERIOD Both Yelamanchili and Russell were Louisiana Sports Writers Association First Team members and were ranked as the No PERIOD  doubles team in the nation last season PERIOD

Brooke Theis a former fivestar recruit out of Illinois dominated in her sophomore season debut going  in singles and  in her lone doubles match with fellow sophomore Sean Mullen PERIOD

The Tulane womens tennis team started the season playing some of their best tennis setting the stage for a big season this year PERIOD Every player who participated won at least one match this weekend a huge testament to the talent of this team and coaches PERIOD The Green Wave will try to continue its success at the Ita Riviera AllAmerican Championships in Cary North Carolina beginning Oct PERIOD  PERIOD

Your donation will support the student journalists of Tulane University PERIOD Your contribution will allow us to purchase equipment and cover our annual website hosting costs PERIOD
